pull_request.title: Add TransactionEvents to `TransactionController`
pull_request.body:
## Explanation

This PR aims to add `TransactionEvents` to `TransactionController`. When certain transaction events happen, controller emits events accordingly. 

## References

<!--
Are there any issues that this pull request is tied to? Are there other links that reviewers should consult to understand these changes better?

For example:

* Fixes #12345
* Related to #67890
-->

* Fixes https://github.com/MetaMask/MetaMask-planning/issues/1054

## Changelog

<!--
If you're making any consumer-facing changes, list those changes here as if you were updating a changelog, using the template below as a guide.

(CATEGORY is one of BREAKING, ADDED, CHANGED, DEPRECATED, REMOVED, or FIXED. For security-related issues, follow the Security Advisory process.)

Please take care to name the exact pieces of the API you've added or changed (e.g. types, interfaces, functions, or methods).

If there are any breaking changes, make sure to offer a solution for consumers to follow once they upgrade to the changes.

Finally, if you're only making changes to development scripts or tests, you may replace the template below with "None".
-->

### `@metamask/transaction-controller`

- **ADDED**: Add `TransactionEvents` to be emitted from `TransactionController`

## Checklist

- [x] I've updated the test suite for new or updated code as appropriate
- [x] I've updated documentation (JSDoc, Markdown, etc.) for new or updated code as appropriate
- [x] I've highlighted breaking changes using the "BREAKING" category above as appropriate

pull_request.title: Add `onBootCleanup` functionality to constructor and `onNetworkChange`
pull_request.body:
## Explanation

This PR aims to bring `onBootCleanup` functionality to the core `TransactionController`. It is also removing the `initApprovals` function because it's unnecessary to do it in client, and put that logic into `onBootCleanup`.

PR is not going to be marked as _breaking change_ since `initApprovals` is not in the use of mobile anyways. 

### `loadingDefaults` property removed

This property is been used to tell the ui when we are done calculating gas but it’s not used anymore (in the extension, nor in mobile), so while bringing this functionality to core, I decided to delete it.

## References

Fixes https://github.com/MetaMask/MetaMask-planning/issues/1473

## Changelog

<!--
If you're making any consumer-facing changes, list those changes here as if you were updating a changelog, using the template below as a guide.

(CATEGORY is one of BREAKING, ADDED, CHANGED, DEPRECATED, REMOVED, or FIXED. For security-related issues, follow the Security Advisory process.)

Please take care to name the exact pieces of the API you've added or changed (e.g. types, interfaces, functions, or methods).

If there are any breaking changes, make sure to offer a solution for consumers to follow once they upgrade to the changes.

Finally, if you're only making changes to development scripts or tests, you may replace the template below with "None".
-->

### `@metamask/transaction-controller`

- **Added**: `onBootCleanup` functionality to constructor and `onNetworkChange`
  - Initialises approvals of `TransactionStatus.unapproved` transactions on active network
  - Refreshes the gas values for `TransactionStatus.unapproved` transactions on active network
  - Submits the `TransactionStatus.approved` transactions on active network

## Checklist

- [x] I've updated the test suite for new or updated code as appropriate
- [x] I've updated documentation (JSDoc, Markdown, etc.) for new or updated code as appropriate
- [x] I've highlighted breaking changes using the "BREAKING" category above as appropriate

comment.body:
This didn't fixed it but I had another look 
```
Type '{ transactions: { history: { id: string; from: string; chainId: `0x${string}`; status: TransactionStatus; txParams: { from: string; to: string; }; }[]; from: string; chainId: `0x${string}`; status: TransactionStatus; txParams: { from: string; to: string; }; id: string; }[]; methodData: {}; lastFetchedBlockNumbers: {...' is not assignable to type 'Partial<TransactionState>'.
  Types of property 'transactions' are incompatible.
    Type '{ history: { id: string; from: string; chainId: `0x${string}`; status: TransactionStatus; txParams: { from: string; to: string; }; }[]; from: string; chainId: `0x${string}`; status: TransactionStatus; txParams: { ...; }; id: string; }[]' is not assignable to type 'TransactionMeta[]'.
      Type '{ history: { id: string; from: string; chainId: `0x${string}`; status: TransactionStatus; txParams: { from: string; to: string; }; }[]; from: string; chainId: `0x${string}`; status: TransactionStatus; txParams: { from: string; to: string; }; id: string; }' is not assignable to type 'TransactionMeta'.
        Type '{ history: { id: string; from: string; chainId: `0x${string}`; status: TransactionStatus; txParams: { from: string; to: string; }; }[]; from: string; chainId: `0x${string}`; status: TransactionStatus; txParams: { from: string; to: string; }; id: string; }' is not assignable to type '{ status: TransactionStatus.failed; error: Error; } & TransactionMetaBase'.
          Property 'error' is missing in type '{ history: { id: string; from: string; chainId: `0x${string}`; status: TransactionStatus; txParams: { from: string; to: string; }; }[]; from: string; chainId: `0x${string}`; status: TransactionStatus; txParams: { from: string; to: string; }; id: string; }' but required in type '{ status: TransactionStatus.failed; error: Error; }'.ts(2322)
```
This is the full lint log. Do I misread here or is it expecting `error` even if it's not a failed status? :S

pull_request.title: Add swaps logic into `TransactionController`
pull_request.body:
## Explanation

With ongoing effort of `TransactionController` alignment between mobile and extension, this PR aims to add update swaps transaction logic. 

## References

Fixes: https://github.com/MetaMask/MetaMask-planning/issues/1054

## Changelog

### `@metamask/transaction-controller`

- **BREAKING**: Swap transaction update could be prevented by setting `disableSwaps` as `true`, if not set it will default to `false`
  - This value must be set to `true` in mobile, since it doesn't use any swap logic. 
  - If `disableSwaps` is `false` or not set, then `createSwapsTransaction` callback must be defined.
  
## Checklist

- [X] I've updated the test suite for new or updated code as appropriate
- [X] I've updated documentation (JSDoc, Markdown, etc.) for new or updated code as appropriate
- [X] I've highlighted breaking changes using the "BREAKING" category above as appropriate

pull_request.title: Add swaps logic into `TransactionController`
pull_request.body:
## Explanation

With ongoing effort of `TransactionController` alignment between mobile and extension, this PR aims to add update swaps transaction logic. 

## References

Fixes: https://github.com/MetaMask/MetaMask-planning/issues/1054

## Changelog

### `@metamask/transaction-controller`

- **BREAKING**: Swap transaction update could be prevented by setting `disableSwaps` as `true`, if not set it will default to `false`
  - This value must be set to `true` in mobile, since it doesn't use any swap logic. 
  - If `disableSwaps` is `false` or not set, then `createSwapsTransaction` callback must be defined.
  
## Checklist

- [X] I've updated the test suite for new or updated code as appropriate
- [X] I've updated documentation (JSDoc, Markdown, etc.) for new or updated code as appropriate
- [X] I've highlighted breaking changes using the "BREAKING" category above as appropriate
